All privacy rights will be protected.','true','!*!%3Cp style=%22margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;%22%3E%3Ca href=%22https://www.mass.gov/guides/masscareers-apply-for-a-job-guide%22 rel=%22external%22%3EApply for a Job%3C/a%3E%3Cbr /%3E%0A%3Ca href=%22https://www.mass.gov/guides/masscareers-apply-for-a-job-guide-for-jaws-users%22 rel=%22external%22%3EApply for a Job for JAWS Users%3C/a%3E%3Cbr /%3E%0A%3Ca href=%22https://www.mass.gov/guides/masscareers-create-a-profile-guide%22 rel=%22external%22%3ECreate a Profile%3C/a%3E%3Cbr /%3E%0A%3Ca href=%22https://www.mass.gov/guides/masscareers-create-a-profile-guide-for-jaws-users%22 rel=%22external%22%3ECreate a Profile for JAWS Users%3C/a%3E%3Cbr /%3E%0A%3Ca href=%22https://www.mass.gov/info-details/masscareers-resources#masscareers-system-requirements-%22 rel=%22external%22%3ESystem Requirements%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E','Apply for this position online','Apply to this position by email','Add this position to the job cart','Previous','Go to the previous job','Next','Go to the next job']); api.fillList('requisitionDescriptionInterface', 'descRequisition', ['1066644','true','1066644','false','Submission for the position: Gaming System Development Intern - (Job Number: 260000AB)','false','1066644','false','true','Gaming System Development Intern','260000AB','!*!%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Cstrong%3EPROGRAM OVERVIEW%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EThe Massachusetts State Lottery Commission (“MSLC”) Summer Internship Program provides emerging leaders with the opportunity to build a foundational understanding of career pathways in public service through experiential learning opportunities.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EInterns will participate in weekly professional development workshops, mentoring opportunities, and conclude the program with a final presentation to showcase the insights they’ve developed over the summer.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Cstrong%3EJOB SUMMARY%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoPlainText%22%3EThe Gaming System Development team creates and supports software in the Lottery’s online transaction processing system, which includes point-of-sale wagering and validation, monitor game displays, transaction intake and logging, and draw execution. The intern will assist software engineers in their day-to-day assignments and activities, and in doing so will research development tools and needs, learn and organize through collaboration tools, and analyze and contribute to coding, amongst other tasks. This role will provide the opportunity to engage in the software development lifecycle, get exposure to different technical software stacks, learn about the gaming and lottery industry, and ultimately help support the Lottery’s mission. %26nbsp;%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoBodyText%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Cstrong%3EESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EParticipate in technical discussions and activities related to software development through daily stand-ups and project meetings.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EHelp organize project requirements, user requests and documentation in Teams (as well as other Office suite applications), ServiceNow and Jira.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EAnalyze and work with C, Java, and JavaScript source code, amongst others, and engage in code reviews.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EUtilize development tools in various environments.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EPerform physical and emulated unit testing of software.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EProvide creative solutions to development issues.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EComplete related tasks, as needed.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoHeader%22 style=%22tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in;%22%3E%3Cstrong%3ESCHEDULE%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoHeader%22 style=%22tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in;%22%3EThis is a full-time paid internship from June 1, 2026 - August 28, 2026. Program dates can be flexible based on the selected candidate%27s school schedule.%26nbsp;%3Ca name=%22_Hlk158905214%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoHeader%22 style=%22tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in;%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoHeader%22 style=%22tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in;%22%3EThis internship is hybrid eligible. The hybrid schedule requires a minimum of 2 days/week in the Braintree office. One of those days must be either a Monday or a Friday. Additional in-person days may be required for training, meetings or team projects.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Cstrong%3EWHO WE ARE%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22 style=%22line-height:107%;%22%3EThe mission of The Lottery is to:%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22 style=%22line-height:107%;%22%3ESecure the integrity of our games;%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22 style=%22line-height:107%;%22%3EProtect the well-being of our customers;%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22 style=%22line-height:107%;%22%3EMaximize revenues returned to the Commonwealth for the benefit of our cities and towns.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22 style=%22mso-pagination:none;%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22 style=%22line-height:107%;%22%3ESince selling its first ticket in 1972, the Mass Lottery has generated over %24161 billion in revenues, awarded over %24114 billion in prizes, returned over %2434 billion in net profit to the Commonwealth for unrestricted local aid provided to cities and towns, and paid over %249.2 billion in commissions and bonuses to its statewide network of retailers. More information can be found on our website at %3Ca href=%22https://www.masslottery.com/%22%3Ehttps://www.masslottery.com/%3C/a%3E.%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22 style=%22line-height:107%;%22%3E%3Cspan style=%22color:red;%22%3E%3Cstrong%3EAPPLICATION DEADLINE IS FEBRUARY 28, 2026. INTERVIEWS WILL BE SCHEDULED IN MARCH.%3C/strong%3E%3C/span%3E%3Cspan style=%22background-color:white;color:black;font-size:12.0pt;%22%3E%3Cspan style=%22line-height:107%;%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/span%3E%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E','!*!%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Cstrong%3EPROGRAM OVERVIEW%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EThe Massachusetts State Lottery Commission (“MSLC”) Summer Internship Program provides emerging leaders with the opportunity to build a foundational understanding of career pathways in public service through experiential learning opportunities.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EInterns will participate in weekly professional development workshops, mentoring opportunities, and conclude the program with a final presentation to showcase the insights they’ve developed over the summer.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Cstrong%3EJOB SUMMARY%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoPlainText%22%3EThe Gaming System Development team creates and supports software in the Lottery’s online transaction processing system, which includes point-of-sale wagering and validation, monitor game displays, transaction intake and logging, and draw execution. The intern will assist software engineers in their day-to-day assignments and activities, and in doing so will research development tools and needs, learn and organize through collaboration tools, and analyze and contribute to coding, amongst other tasks. This role will provide the opportunity to engage in the software development lifecycle, get exposure to different technical software stacks, learn about the gaming and lottery industry, and ultimately help support the Lottery’s mission. %26nbsp;%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoBodyText%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Cstrong%3EESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EParticipate in technical discussions and activities related to software development through daily stand-ups and project meetings.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EHelp organize project requirements, user requests and documentation in Teams (as well as other Office suite applications), ServiceNow and Jira.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EAnalyze and work with C, Java, and JavaScript source code, amongst others, and engage in code reviews.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EUtilize development tools in various environments.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EPerform physical and emulated unit testing of software.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EProvide creative solutions to development issues.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EComplete related tasks, as needed.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoHeader%22 style=%22tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in;%22%3E%3Cstrong%3ESCHEDULE%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoHeader%22 style=%22tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in;%22%3EThis is a full-time paid internship from June 1, 2026 - August 28, 2026.
